text: Rowley Island is one of the Canadian Arctic islands in Qikiqtaaluk Region, Nunavut. It is located in Foxe Basin and has an area of . Although the island is uninhabited there is both an unmanned Distant Early Warning Line base, called FOX-1 at , and an Automated Surface Observing System. It is named after the arctic explorer Graham Westbrook Rowley. ==References== ==External links== * FOX-1 historical information * Past 24 hours weather Category:Islands of Foxe Basin Category:Uninhabited islands of Qikiqtaaluk Region Category:Former populated places in the Qikiqtaaluk Region Category:Former populated places in Arctic Canada Category:Islands of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago
title: Rowley Island
